title: encoding/xml: Encoder encodes double quotes incorrectly.
body:
xml.Encoder encodes a double quote in a text node into the entity &#34;. Technically this a valid entity. But the standard is to encode a double quote into &quot; instead. This is the standard when not using a DTD. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_XML_and_HTML_character_entity_references#Predefined_entities_in_XML

I only noticed this because it sends riak-cs haywire when used with the aws-sdk-go client (an AWS s3 client written in go).

Here is an example.
https://gist.github.com/dragonfax/ca3ee45a0acf97820f58
